00023 
00024   TWAIN.h -  This is the definitive include file for applications and
00025           data sources written to the TWAIN specification.
00026           It defines constants, data structures, messages etc.
00027           for the public interface to TWAIN.
00028  
00029   Revision History:
00030     version 1.0, March 6, 1992.  TWAIN 1.0.
00031     version 1.1, January 1993.   Tech Notes 1.1
00032     version 1.5, June 1993.      Specification Update 1.5
00033                                  Change DC to TW 
00034                                  Change filename from DC.H to TWAIN.H
00035     version 1.5, July 1993.      Remove spaces from country identifiers
00036  
00037     version 1.7, July 1997       Added Capabilities and data structure for 
00038                                  document imaging and digital cameras.
00039                                  KHL.
00040     version 1.7, July 1997       Inserted Borland compatibile structure packing
00041                                  directives provided by Mentor.  JMH
00042     version 1.7, Aug 1997        Expanded file tabs to spaces.  
00043                                  NOTE: future authors should be sure to have 
00044                                  their editors set to automatically expand tabs 
00045                                  to spaces (original tab setting was 4 spaces).
00046     version 1.7, Sept 1997       Added job control values
00047                                  Added return codes
00048     version 1.7, Sept 1997       changed definition of pRGBRESPONSE to 
00049                                  pTW_RGBRESPONSE
00050     version 1.7  Aug 1998        Added missing TWEI_BARCODEROTATION values
00051                                  TWBCOR_ types JMH
00052     version 1.8  August 1998     Added new types and definitions required
00053                                  for 1.8 Specification JMH
00054     version 1.8  January 1999    Changed search mode from SRCH_ to TWBD_ as
00055                                  in 1.8 Specification, added TWBT_MAXICODE  JMH
00056     version 1.8  January 1999    Removed undocumented duplicate AUTO<cap> JMH
00057     version 1.8  March 1999      Removed undocumented 1.8 caps:
00058                                  CAP_FILESYSTEM
00059                                  CAP_PAPERBINDING
00060                                  CAP_PASSTHRU
00061                                  CAP_POWERDOWNTIME
00062                                  ICAP_AUTODISCARDBLANKPAGES
00063                                * CAP_PAGEMULTIPLEACQUIRE - is CAP_REACQUIREALLOWED,
00064                                  requires spec change.  JMH
00065                                  Added Mac structure packing modifications JMH
00066     version 1.9  March 2000      Added new types and definations required
00067                                  for 1.9 Specification MLM
00068     version 1.9  March 2000      Added ICAP_JPEGQUALITY, TWJQ_ values,
00069                                  updated TWON_PROTOCOLMINOR for Release v1.9 MN
00070 
00071 March 23, 2005 - I have modified this file to work under Unix.  I have added
00072 automatic sensing of the compiler and structure packing pragmas. - FHH

00076 #ifndef TWAIN
00077 #define TWAIN

00079 /****************************************************************************
00080  * TWAIN Version                                                            *
00081  ****************************************************************************/
00082 #define TWON_PROTOCOLMINOR   9        /* Changed for Version 1.9            */
00083 #define TWON_PROTOCOLMAJOR   1
00084 
00085 /****************************************************************************
00086  * Platform Dependent Definitions and Typedefs                              *
00087  ****************************************************************************/
00088 
00089 /* Define one of the following, depending on the platform */
00090 /* Microsoft C/C++ Compiler */
00091 #if _MSC_VER
00092 #define TWH_CMP_MSC
00093   #if _WIN32
00094   #define TWH_32BIT
00095   #define _MSWIN_
00096   #elif _WIN64
00097     #define TWH_64BIT
00098     #define _MSWIN_
00099   #endif
00100 
00101 /* GNU C/C++ Compiler  */
00102 #elif __GNUC__
00103   #define _UNIX_
00104   #define TWH_CMP_GNU
00105   #define TWH_32BIT
00106 
00107 /* Borland C/C++ Compiler  */
00108 #elif __BORLAND__
00109 #define TWH_CMP_BORLAND
00110   #define TWH_32BIT
00111 
00112 /* CodeWarrior Compiler  */
00113 #elif __APPLE__
00114   #define _MAC_
00115   #define TWH_CMP_CODEWARRIOR
00116   #define TWH_32BIT
00117 /* Unrecognized */
00118 #else
00119   #error Unrecognized compiler
00120 #endif
00121 
00122 #ifdef  _MSWIN_
00123     /*  SDH - 02/08/95 - TWUNK */
00124     /*  Force 32-bit twain to use same packing of twain structures as existing */
00125     /*  16-bit twain.  This allows 16/32-bit thunking.                         */
00126     #ifdef __BORLANDC__ //(Mentor June 13, 1996) if using a Borland compiler
00127         #pragma option -a2  //(Mentor June 13, 1996) switch to word alignment
00128     #else   //(Mentor June 13, 1996) if we're using some other compiler
00129         #pragma pack (push, before_twain)
00130         #pragma pack (2)
00131     #endif  //(Mentor June 13, 1996)
00132 
00133     typedef HANDLE         TW_HANDLE;
00134     typedef LPVOID         TW_MEMREF;
00135 
00136     /*  SDH - 05/05/95 - TWUNK */
00137     /*  For common code between 16 and 32 bits.  */
00138     #ifdef  WIN32
00139         #define TW_HUGE
00140     #else   /* WIN32 */
00141         #define TW_HUGE    huge
00142     #endif  /* WIN32 */
00143     typedef BYTE TW_HUGE * HPBYTE;
00144     typedef void TW_HUGE * HPVOID;
00145 #endif  /* _MSWIN_ */
00146 
00147 #ifdef  _MAC_
00148     /*
00149     * NOTE:
00150     * Corrected to allow building of TWAIN MacOS PowerPC Applications
00151     * and MacOS PowerPC TWAIN sources.
00152     *
00153     * The modification allows a PowerPC Application to use a 
00154     * TWAIN 68k Source and a PowerPC Source to be used by a 68k Application.
00155     *
00156     * The modification concerns the data alignment of the C-Structures used by 
00157     * TWAIN during the communication between the Application and Source.
00158     *
00159     * The Data Alignment must be  68k code and not PowerPC.
00160     * - Paul Plaquette, LOGi 27, FRANCE-Montpellier
00161     */
00162     #if PRAGMA_STRUCT_ALIGN
00163          #pragma options align=mac68k
00164     #elif PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH
00165          #pragma pack(push, 2)
00166     #elif PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK
00167          #pragma pack(2)
00168     #endif
00169 
00170     #define PASCAL         pascal
00171     #define FAR
00172     typedef Handle         TW_HANDLE;
00173     typedef char          *TW_MEMREF;
00174 #endif  /* _MAC_ */
00175 
00176 #ifdef  _UNIX_
00177     #pragma pack (2)
00178 
00179     #ifndef FALSE
00180          #define FALSE 0
00181          #define TRUE (!FALSE)
00182     #endif // FALSE
00183 
00184     #define PASCAL
00185     #define FAR
00186 
00187     typedef void* TW_HANDLE;
00188     typedef char* TW_MEMREF;
00189 
00190     typedef void* LPVOID;
00191 
00192     typedef TW_HANDLE HANDLE;
00193 #endif  /* _UNIX_ */
00194 
00195 /****************************************************************************
00196  * Type Definitions                                                         *
00197  ****************************************************************************/
00198 
00199 /* String types. These include room for the strings and a NULL char,     *
00200  * or, on the Mac, a length byte followed by the string.                 *
00201  * TW_STR255 must hold less than 256 chars so length fits in first byte. */
00202 typedef char    TW_STR32[34],     FAR *pTW_STR32;
00203 typedef char    TW_STR64[66],     FAR *pTW_STR64;
00204 typedef char    TW_STR128[130],   FAR *pTW_STR128;
00205 typedef char    TW_STR255[256],   FAR *pTW_STR255;
00206 typedef char    TW_STR1024[1026], FAR *pTW_STR1024;   /* added 1.9 */
00207 typedef wchar_t TW_UNI512[512],   FAR *pTW_UNI512;    /* added 1.9 */
00208 
00209 /* Numeric types. */
00210 typedef char           TW_INT8,   FAR *pTW_INT8;
00211 typedef short          TW_INT16,  FAR *pTW_INT16; 
00212 typedef long           TW_INT32,  FAR *pTW_INT32;
00213 typedef unsigned char  TW_UINT8,  FAR *pTW_UINT8;
00214 typedef unsigned short TW_UINT16, FAR *pTW_UINT16;
00215 typedef unsigned long  TW_UINT32, FAR *pTW_UINT32;
00216 typedef unsigned short TW_BOOL,   FAR *pTW_BOOL; 
00217 
00218 /* Fixed point structure type. */
00219 typedef struct {
00220     TW_INT16     Whole;        /* maintains the sign */
00221     TW_UINT16    Frac;
00222 } TW_FIX32,  FAR *pTW_FIX32;
00223 
00224 /****************************************************************************
00225  * Structure Definitions                                                    *
00226  ****************************************************************************/
00227 
00228 /* No DAT needed. */
00229 typedef struct {
00230    TW_FIX32   X;
00231    TW_FIX32   Y;
00232    TW_FIX32   Z;
00233 } TW_CIEPOINT, FAR * pTW_CIEPOINT;
00234 
00235 /* No DAT needed. */
00236 typedef struct {
00237    TW_FIX32   StartIn;
00238    TW_FIX32   BreakIn;
00239    TW_FIX32   EndIn;
00240    TW_FIX32   StartOut;
00241    TW_FIX32   BreakOut;
00242    TW_FIX32   EndOut;
00243    TW_FIX32   Gamma;
00244    TW_FIX32   SampleCount;  /* if =0 use the gamma */
00245 } TW_DECODEFUNCTION, FAR * pTW_DECODEFUNCTION;
00246 
00247 /* No DAT needed. */
00248 typedef struct {
00249    TW_UINT8    Index;    /* Value used to index into the color table. */
00250    TW_UINT8    Channel1; /* First  tri-stimulus value (e.g Red)       */
00251    TW_UINT8    Channel2; /* Second tri-stimulus value (e.g Green)     */
00252    TW_UINT8    Channel3; /* Third  tri-stimulus value (e.g Blue)      */
00253 } TW_ELEMENT8, FAR * pTW_ELEMENT8;
00254 
00255 /* No DAT.  Defines a frame rectangle in ICAP_UNITS coordinates. */
00256 typedef struct {
00257    TW_FIX32   Left;
00258    TW_FIX32   Top;
00259    TW_FIX32   Right;
00260    TW_FIX32   Bottom;
00261 } TW_FRAME, FAR * pTW_FRAME;
00262 
00263 /* No DAT needed.  Used to manage memory buffers. */
00264 typedef struct {
00265    TW_UINT32  Flags;  /* Any combination of the TWMF_ constants.           */
00266    TW_UINT32  Length; /* Number of bytes stored in buffer TheMem.          */
00267    TW_MEMREF  TheMem; /* Pointer or handle to the allocated memory buffer. */
00268 } TW_MEMORY, FAR * pTW_MEMORY;
00269 
00270 /* No DAT needed. */
00271 typedef struct {
00272    TW_DECODEFUNCTION   Decode[3];
00273    TW_FIX32            Mix[3][3];
00274 } TW_TRANSFORMSTAGE, FAR * pTW_TRANSFORMSTAGE;
00275 
00276 /* No DAT needed.  Describes version of software currently running. */
00277 typedef struct {
00278    TW_UINT16  MajorNum;  /* Major revision number of the software. */
00279    TW_UINT16  MinorNum;  /* Incremental revision number of the software. */
00280    TW_UINT16  Language;  /* e.g. TWLG_SWISSFRENCH */
00281    TW_UINT16  Country;   /* e.g. TWCY_SWITZERLAND */
00282    TW_STR32   Info;      /* e.g. "1.0b3 Beta release" */
00283 } TW_VERSION, FAR * pTW_VERSION;
00284 
00285 /* TWON_ARRAY. Container for array of values (a simplified TW_ENUMERATION) */
00286 typedef struct {
00287    TW_UINT16  ItemType;
00288    TW_UINT32  NumItems;    /* How many items in ItemList           */
00289    TW_UINT8   ItemList[1]; /* Array of ItemType values starts here */
00290 } TW_ARRAY, FAR * pTW_ARRAY;
00291 
00292 /* TWON_ENUMERATION. Container for a collection of values. */
00293 typedef struct {
00294    TW_UINT16  ItemType;
00295    TW_UINT32  NumItems;     /* How many items in ItemList                 */
00296    TW_UINT32  CurrentIndex; /* Current value is in ItemList[CurrentIndex] */
00297    TW_UINT32  DefaultIndex; /* Powerup value is in ItemList[DefaultIndex] */
00298    TW_UINT8   ItemList[1];  /* Array of ItemType values starts here       */
00299 } TW_ENUMERATION, FAR * pTW_ENUMERATION;
00300 
00301 /* TWON_ONEVALUE. Container for one value. */
00302 typedef struct {
00303    TW_UINT16  ItemType;
00304    TW_UINT32  Item;
00305 } TW_ONEVALUE, FAR * pTW_ONEVALUE;
00306 
00307 /* TWON_RANGE. Container for a range of values. */
00308 typedef struct {
00309    TW_UINT16  ItemType;
00310    TW_UINT32  MinValue;     /* Starting value in the range.           */
00311    TW_UINT32  MaxValue;     /* Final value in the range.              */
00312    TW_UINT32  StepSize;     /* Increment from MinValue to MaxValue.   */
00313    TW_UINT32  DefaultValue; /* Power-up value.                        */
00314    TW_UINT32  CurrentValue; /* The value that is currently in effect. */
00315 } TW_RANGE, FAR * pTW_RANGE;
00316 
00317 /* DAT_CAPABILITY. Used by application to get/set capability from/in a data source. */
00318 typedef struct {
00319    TW_UINT16  Cap; /* id of capability to set or get, e.g. CAP_BRIGHTNESS */
00320    TW_UINT16  ConType; /* TWON_ONEVALUE, _RANGE, _ENUMERATION or _ARRAY   */
00321    TW_HANDLE  hContainer; /* Handle to container of type Dat              */
00322 } TW_CAPABILITY, FAR * pTW_CAPABILITY;
00323 
00324 /* DAT_CIECOLOR. */
00325 typedef struct {
00326    TW_UINT16           ColorSpace;
00327    TW_INT16            LowEndian;
00328    TW_INT16            DeviceDependent;
00329    TW_INT32            VersionNumber;
00330    TW_TRANSFORMSTAGE   StageABC;
00331    TW_TRANSFORMSTAGE   StageLMN;
00332    TW_CIEPOINT         WhitePoint;
00333    TW_CIEPOINT         BlackPoint;
00334    TW_CIEPOINT         WhitePaper;
00335    TW_CIEPOINT         BlackInk;
00336    TW_FIX32            Samples[1];
00337 } TW_CIECOLOR, FAR * pTW_CIECOLOR;
00338 
00339 /* DAT_EVENT. For passing events down from the application to the DS. */
00340 typedef struct {
00341    TW_MEMREF  pEvent;    /* Windows pMSG or Mac pEvent.                 */
00342    TW_UINT16  TWMessage; /* TW msg from data source, e.g. MSG_XFERREADY */
00343 } TW_EVENT, FAR * pTW_EVENT;
00344 
00345 /* DAT_GRAYRESPONSE */
00346 typedef struct {
00347    TW_ELEMENT8         Response[1];
00348 } TW_GRAYRESPONSE, FAR * pTW_GRAYRESPONSE;
00349 
00350 /* DAT_IDENTITY. Identifies the program/library/code resource. */
00351 typedef struct {
00352    TW_UINT32  Id;              /* Unique number.  Initilized to 0.  Set by DSM   */
00353    TW_VERSION Version;         /* Identifies the piece of code              */
00354    TW_UINT16  ProtocolMajor;   /* Application and DS must set to TWON_PROTOCOLMAJOR */
00355    TW_UINT16  ProtocolMinor;   /* Application and DS must set to TWON_PROTOCOLMINOR */
00356    TW_UINT32  SupportedGroups; /* Bit field OR combination of DG_ constants */
00357    TW_STR32   Manufacturer;    /* Manufacturer name, e.g. "Hewlett-Packard" */
00358    TW_STR32   ProductFamily;   /* Product family name, e.g. "ScanJet"       */
00359    TW_STR32   ProductName;     /* Product name, e.g. "ScanJet Plus"         */
00360 } TW_IDENTITY, FAR * pTW_IDENTITY;
00361 
00362 /* DAT_IMAGEINFO. Application gets detailed image info from DS with this. */
00363 typedef struct {
00364    TW_FIX32   XResolution;      /* Resolution in the horizontal             */
00365    TW_FIX32   YResolution;      /* Resolution in the vertical               */
00366    TW_INT32   ImageWidth;       /* Columns in the image, -1 if unknown by DS*/
00367    TW_INT32   ImageLength;      /* Rows in the image, -1 if unknown by DS   */
00368    TW_INT16   SamplesPerPixel;  /* Number of samples per pixel, 3 for RGB   */
00369    TW_INT16   BitsPerSample[8]; /* Number of bits for each sample           */
00370    TW_INT16   BitsPerPixel;     /* Number of bits for each padded pixel     */
00371    TW_BOOL    Planar;           /* True if Planar, False if chunky          */
00372    TW_INT16   PixelType;        /* How to interp data; photo interp (TWPT_) */
00373    TW_UINT16  Compression;      /* How the data is compressed (TWCP_xxxx)   */
00374 } TW_IMAGEINFO, FAR * pTW_IMAGEINFO;
00375 
00376 /* DAT_IMAGELAYOUT. Provides image layout information in current units. */
00377 typedef struct {
00378    TW_FRAME   Frame;          /* Frame coords within larger document */
00379    TW_UINT32  DocumentNumber;
00380    TW_UINT32  PageNumber;     /* Reset when you go to next document  */
00381    TW_UINT32  FrameNumber;    /* Reset when you go to next page      */
00382 } TW_IMAGELAYOUT, FAR * pTW_IMAGELAYOUT;
00383 
00384 /* DAT_IMAGEMEMXFER. Used to pass image data (e.g. in strips) from DS to application.*/
00385 typedef struct {
00386    TW_UINT16  Compression;  /* How the data is compressed                */
00387    TW_UINT32  BytesPerRow;  /* Number of bytes in a row of data          */
00388    TW_UINT32  Columns;      /* How many columns                          */
00389    TW_UINT32  Rows;         /* How many rows                             */
00390    TW_UINT32  XOffset;      /* How far from the side of the image        */
00391    TW_UINT32  YOffset;      /* How far from the top of the image         */
00392    TW_UINT32  BytesWritten; /* How many bytes written in Memory          */
00393    TW_MEMORY  Memory;       /* Mem struct used to pass actual image data */
00394 } TW_IMAGEMEMXFER, FAR * pTW_IMAGEMEMXFER;
00395 
00396 /* Changed in 1.1: QuantTable, HuffmanDC, HuffmanAC TW_MEMREF -> TW_MEMORY  */
00397 /* DAT_JPEGCOMPRESSION. Based on JPEG Draft International Std, ver 10918-1. */
00398 typedef struct {
00399    TW_UINT16   ColorSpace;       /* One of the TWPT_xxxx values                */
00400    TW_UINT32   SubSampling;      /* Two word "array" for subsampling values    */
00401    TW_UINT16   NumComponents;    /* Number of color components in image        */
00402    TW_UINT16   RestartFrequency; /* Frequency of restart marker codes in MDU's */
00403    TW_UINT16   QuantMap[4];      /* Mapping of components to QuantTables       */
00404    TW_MEMORY   QuantTable[4];    /* Quantization tables                        */
00405    TW_UINT16   HuffmanMap[4];    /* Mapping of components to Huffman tables    */
00406    TW_MEMORY   HuffmanDC[2];     /* DC Huffman tables                          */
00407    TW_MEMORY   HuffmanAC[2];     /* AC Huffman tables                          */
00408 } TW_JPEGCOMPRESSION, FAR * pTW_JPEGCOMPRESSION;
00409 
00410 /* DAT_PALETTE8. Color palette when TWPT_PALETTE pixels xfer'd in mem buf. */
00411 typedef struct {
00412    TW_UINT16    NumColors;   /* Number of colors in the color table.  */
00413    TW_UINT16    PaletteType; /* TWPA_xxxx, specifies type of palette. */
00414    TW_ELEMENT8  Colors[256]; /* Array of palette values starts here.  */
00415 } TW_PALETTE8, FAR * pTW_PALETTE8;
00416 
00417 /* DAT_PENDINGXFERS. Used with MSG_ENDXFER to indicate additional data. */
00418 typedef struct {
00419    TW_UINT16 Count;
00420    union {
00421       TW_UINT32 EOJ;
00422       TW_UINT32 Reserved;
00423    };
00424 } TW_PENDINGXFERS, FAR *pTW_PENDINGXFERS;
00425 
00426 /* DAT_RGBRESPONSE */
00427 typedef struct {
00428    TW_ELEMENT8         Response[1];
00429 } TW_RGBRESPONSE, FAR * pTW_RGBRESPONSE;
00430 
00431 /* DAT_SETUPFILEXFER. Sets up DS to application data transfer via a file. */
00432 typedef struct {
00433    TW_STR255 FileName;
00434    TW_UINT16 Format;   /* Any TWFF_ constant */
00435    TW_INT16  VRefNum;  /* Used for Mac only  */
00436 } TW_SETUPFILEXFER, FAR * pTW_SETUPFILEXFER;
00437 
00438 /* DAT_SETUPFILEXFER2. Sets up DS to application data transfer via a file. */
00439 /* Added 1.9                                                               */
00440 typedef struct {
00441    TW_MEMREF FileName;     /* Pointer to file name text */
00442    TW_UINT16 FileNameType; /* TWTY_STR1024 or TWTY_UNI512 */
00443    TW_UINT16 Format;       /* Any TWFF_ constant */
00444    TW_INT16  VRefNum;      /* Used for Mac only  */
00445    TW_UINT32 parID;        /* Used for Mac only */
00446 } TW_SETUPFILEXFER2, FAR * pTW_SETUPFILEXFER2;
00447 
00448 /* DAT_SETUPMEMXFER. Sets up DS to application data transfer via a memory buffer. */
00449 typedef struct {
00450    TW_UINT32 MinBufSize;
00451    TW_UINT32 MaxBufSize;
00452    TW_UINT32 Preferred;
00453 } TW_SETUPMEMXFER, FAR * pTW_SETUPMEMXFER;
00454 
00455 /* DAT_STATUS. Application gets detailed status info from a data source with this. */
00456 typedef struct {
00457    TW_UINT16  ConditionCode; /* Any TWCC_ constant     */
00458    TW_UINT16  Reserved;      /* Future expansion space */
00459 } TW_STATUS, FAR * pTW_STATUS;
00460 
00461 /* DAT_USERINTERFACE. Coordinates UI between application and data source. */
00462 typedef struct {
00463    TW_BOOL    ShowUI;  /* TRUE if DS should bring up its UI           */
00464    TW_BOOL    ModalUI; /* For Mac only - true if the DS's UI is modal */
00465    TW_HANDLE  hParent; /* For windows only - Application window handle        */
00466 } TW_USERINTERFACE, FAR * pTW_USERINTERFACE;
00467 
00468 /* SDH - 03/21/95 - TWUNK */
00469 /* DAT_TWUNKIDENTITY. Provides DS identity and 'other' information necessary */
00470 /*                    across thunk link. */
00471 typedef struct {
00472    TW_IDENTITY identity;        /* Identity of data source.                 */
00473    TW_STR255   dsPath;          /* Full path and file name of data source.  */
00474 } TW_TWUNKIDENTITY, FAR * pTW_TWUNKIDENTITY;
00475 
00476 /* SDH - 03/21/95 - TWUNK */
00477 /* Provides DS_Entry parameters over thunk link. */
00478 typedef struct
00479 {
00480     TW_INT8     destFlag;       /* TRUE if dest is not NULL                 */
00481     TW_IDENTITY dest;           /* Identity of data source (if used)        */
00482     TW_INT32    dataGroup;      /* DSM_Entry dataGroup parameter            */
00483     TW_INT16    dataArgType;    /* DSM_Entry dataArgType parameter          */
00484     TW_INT16    message;        /* DSM_Entry message parameter              */
00485     TW_INT32    pDataSize;      /* Size of pData (0 if NULL)                */
00486     //  TW_MEMREF   pData;      /* Based on implementation specifics, a     */
00487                                 /* pData parameter makes no sense in this   */
00488                                 /* structure, but data (if provided) will be*/
00489                                 /* appended in the data block.              */
00490    } TW_TWUNKDSENTRYPARAMS, FAR * pTW_TWUNKDSENTRYPARAMS;
00491 
00492 /* SDH - 03/21/95 - TWUNK */
00493 /* Provides DS_Entry results over thunk link. */
00494 typedef struct
00495 {
00496     TW_UINT16   returnCode;     /* Thunker DsEntry return code.             */
00497     TW_UINT16   conditionCode;  /* Thunker DsEntry condition code.          */
00498     TW_INT32    pDataSize;      /* Size of pData (0 if NULL)                */
00499     //  TW_MEMREF   pData;      /* Based on implementation specifics, a     */
00500                                 /* pData parameter makes no sense in this   */
00501                                 /* structure, but data (if provided) will be*/
00502                                 /* appended in the data block.              */
00503 } TW_TWUNKDSENTRYRETURN, FAR * pTW_TWUNKDSENTRYRETURN;
00504 
00505 /* WJD - 950818 */
00506 /* Added for 1.6 Specification */
00507 /* TWAIN 1.6 CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPSEXT structure */
00508 typedef struct
00509 {
00510     TW_UINT16 Cap;   /* Which CAP/ICAP info is relevant to */
00511     TW_UINT16 Properties;  /* Messages this CAP/ICAP supports */
00512 } TW_CAPEXT, FAR * pTW_CAPEXT;

00514 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------- *\
00515 
00516   Version 1.7:      Added Following data structure for Document Imaging 
00517   July 1997         Enhancement.
00518   KHL               TW_CUSTOMDSDATA --  For Saving and Restoring Source's 
00519                                         state.
00520                     TW_INFO         --  Each attribute for extended image
00521                                         information.
00522                     TW_EXTIMAGEINFO --  Extended image information structure.
00523 
00524 \* ----------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00525 
00526 typedef struct {
00527     TW_UINT32  InfoLength;     /* Length of Information in bytes.  */
00528     TW_HANDLE  hData;          /* Place holder for data, DS Allocates */
00529 }TW_CUSTOMDSDATA, FAR *pTW_CUSTOMDSDATA;
00530 
00531 typedef struct {
00532     TW_UINT16   InfoID;
00533     TW_UINT16   ItemType;
00534     TW_UINT16   NumItems;
00535     TW_UINT16   CondCode;
00536     TW_UINT32   Item;
00537 }TW_INFO, FAR* pTW_INFO;
00538 
00539 typedef struct {
00540     TW_UINT32   NumInfos;
00541     TW_INFO     Info[1];
00542 }TW_EXTIMAGEINFO, FAR* pTW_EXTIMAGEINFO;
00543 
00544 /* Added 1.8 */
00545 
00546 /* DAT_AUDIOINFO, information about audio data */
00547 typedef struct {
00548    TW_STR255  Name;       /* name of audio data */
00549    TW_UINT32  Reserved;   /* reserved space */
00550 } TW_AUDIOINFO, FAR * pTW_AUDIOINFO;
00551 
00552 /* DAT_DEVICEEVENT, information about events */
00553 typedef struct {
00554    TW_UINT32  Event;                  /* One of the TWDE_xxxx values. */
00555    TW_STR255  DeviceName;             /* The name of the device that generated the event */
00556    TW_UINT32  BatteryMinutes;         /* Battery Minutes Remaining    */
00557    TW_INT16   BatteryPercentage;      /* Battery Percentage Remaining */
00558    TW_INT32   PowerSupply;            /* Power Supply                 */
00559    TW_FIX32   XResolution;            /* Resolution                   */
00560    TW_FIX32   YResolution;            /* Resolution                   */
00561    TW_UINT32  FlashUsed2;             /* Flash Used2                  */
00562    TW_UINT32  AutomaticCapture;       /* Automatic Capture            */
00563    TW_UINT32  TimeBeforeFirstCapture; /* Automatic Capture            */
00564    TW_UINT32  TimeBetweenCaptures;    /* Automatic Capture            */
00565 } TW_DEVICEEVENT, FAR * pTW_DEVICEEVENT;
00566 
00567 /* DAT_FILESYSTEM, information about TWAIN file system */
00568 typedef struct {
00569    /* DG_CONTROL / DAT_FILESYSTEM / MSG_xxxx fields     */
00570    TW_STR255  InputName; /* The name of the input or source file */
00571    TW_STR255  OutputName; /* The result of an operation or the name of a destination file */
00572    TW_MEMREF  Context; /* Source specific data used to remember state information */
00573    /* DG_CONTROL / DAT_FILESYSTEM / MSG_DELETE field    */
00574    int        Recursive; /* recursively delete all sub-directories */
00575    /* DG_CONTROL / DAT_FILESYSTEM / MSG_GETINFO fields  */
00576    TW_INT32   FileType; /* One of the TWFT_xxxx values */
00577    TW_UINT32  Size; /* Size of current FileType */
00578    TW_STR32   CreateTimeDate; /* creation date of the file */
00579    TW_STR32   ModifiedTimeDate; /* last date the file was modified */
00580    TW_UINT32  FreeSpace; /* bytes of free space on the current device */
00581    TW_INT32   NewImageSize; /* estimate of the amount of space a new image would take up */
00582    TW_UINT32  NumberOfFiles; /* number of files, depends on FileType */
00583    TW_UINT32  NumberOfSnippets; /* number of audio snippets */
00584    TW_UINT32  DeviceGroupMask; /* used to group cameras (ex: front/rear bitonal, front/rear grayscale...) */
00585    char       Reserved[508]; 
00586 } TW_FILESYSTEM, FAR * pTW_FILESYSTEM;
00587 
00588 /* DAT_PASSTHRU, device dependant data to pass through Data Source */
00589 typedef struct {
00590    TW_MEMREF  pCommand;        /* Pointer to Command buffer */
00591    TW_UINT32  CommandBytes;    /* Number of bytes in Command buffer */
00592    TW_INT32   Direction;       /* One of the TWDR_xxxx values.  Defines the direction of data flow */
00593    TW_MEMREF  pData;           /* Pointer to Data buffer */
00594    TW_UINT32  DataBytes;       /* Number of bytes in Data buffer */
00595    TW_UINT32  DataBytesXfered; /* Number of bytes successfully transferred */
00596 } TW_PASSTHRU, FAR * pTW_PASSTHRU;
00597 
00598 /* DAT_SETUPAUDIOFILEXFER, information required to setup an audio file transfer */
00599 typedef struct {
00600    TW_STR255  FileName; /* full path target file */
00601    TW_UINT16  Format;   /* one of TWAF_xxxx */
00602    TW_INT16 VRefNum;
00603 } TW_SETUPAUDIOFILEXFER, FAR * pTW_SETUPAUDIOFILEXFER;
00604 
00605 /* TW_CALLBACK, used to register callbacks */
00606 typedef struct TW_CALLBACK {
00607     TW_MEMREF   CallBackProc;   
00608     TW_UINT32 RefCon;       
00609     TW_INT16    Message;      
00610 } TW_CALLBACK, FAR * pTW_CALLBACK;

00615      */
00616      #if PRAGMA_STRUCT_ALIGN
00617           #pragma options align=reset
00618      #elif PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH
00619           #pragma pack(pop)

00622      #endif

00629 #define TWON_ARRAY           3 /* indicates TW_ARRAY container       */
00630 #define TWON_ENUMERATION     4 /* indicates TW_ENUMERATION container */
00631 #define TWON_ONEVALUE        5 /* indicates TW_ONEVALUE container    */
00632 #define TWON_RANGE           6 /* indicates TW_RANGE container       */
00633 
00634 #define TWON_ICONID          962 /* res Id of icon used in USERSELECT lbox */
00635 #define TWON_DSMID           461 /* res Id of the DSM version num resource */
00636 #define TWON_DSMCODEID       63  /* res Id of the Mac SM Code resource     */
00637 
00638 #define TWON_DONTCARE8       0xff
00639 #define TWON_DONTCARE16      0xffff
00640 #define TWON_DONTCARE32      0xffffffff
00641 
00642 /* Flags used in TW_MEMORY structure. */
00643 #define TWMF_APPOWNS     0x1
00644 #define TWMF_DSMOWNS     0x2
00645 #define TWMF_DSOWNS      0x4
00646 #define TWMF_POINTER     0x8
00647 #define TWMF_HANDLE      0x10
00648 
00649 /* Palette types for TW_PALETTE8 */
00650 #define TWPA_RGB         0
00651 #define TWPA_GRAY        1
00652 #define TWPA_CMY         2
00653 
00654 /* There are four containers used for capabilities negotiation:
00655  *    TWON_ONEVALUE, TWON_RANGE, TWON_ENUMERATION, TWON_ARRAY
00656  * In each container structure ItemType can be TWTY_INT8, TWTY_INT16, etc.
00657  * The kind of data stored in the container can be determined by doing
00658  * DCItemSize[ItemType] where the following is defined in TWAIN glue code:
00659  *          DCItemSize[]= { sizeof(TW_INT8),
00660  *                          sizeof(TW_INT16),
00661  *                          etc.
00662  *                          sizeof(TW_UINT32) };
00663  *
00664  */
00665 
00666 #define TWTY_INT8        0x0000    /* Means Item is a TW_INT8   */
00667 #define TWTY_INT16       0x0001    /* Means Item is a TW_INT16  */
00668 #define TWTY_INT32       0x0002    /* Means Item is a TW_INT32  */
00669 
00670 #define TWTY_UINT8       0x0003    /* Means Item is a TW_UINT8  */
00671 #define TWTY_UINT16      0x0004    /* Means Item is a TW_UINT16 */
00672 #define TWTY_UINT32      0x0005    /* Means Item is a TW_UINT32 */
00673 
00674 #define TWTY_BOOL        0x0006    /* Means Item is a TW_BOOL   */
00675 
00676 #define TWTY_FIX32       0x0007    /* Means Item is a TW_FIX32  */
00677 
00678 #define TWTY_FRAME       0x0008    /* Means Item is a TW_FRAME  */
00679 
00680 #define TWTY_STR32       0x0009    /* Means Item is a TW_STR32  */
00681 #define TWTY_STR64       0x000a    /* Means Item is a TW_STR64  */
00682 #define TWTY_STR128      0x000b    /* Means Item is a TW_STR128 */
00683 #define TWTY_STR255      0x000c    /* Means Item is a TW_STR255 */
00684 #define TWTY_STR1024     0x000d    /* Means Item is a TW_STR1024...added 1.9 */
00685 #define TWTY_UNI512      0x000e    /* Means Item is a TW_UNI512...added 1.9 */
00686

01436 /****************************************************************************
01437  * Data Groups                                                              *
01438  ****************************************************************************/
01439 
01440 /* More Data Groups may be added in the future.
01441  * Possible candidates include text, vector graphics, sound, etc.
01442  * NOTE: Data Group constants must be powers of 2 as they are used
01443  *       as bitflags when Application asks DSM to present a list of DSs.
01444  */
01445 
01446 #define DG_CONTROL          0x0001L /* data pertaining to control       */
01447 #define DG_IMAGE            0x0002L /* data pertaining to raster images */
01448 /* Added 1.8 */
01449 #define DG_AUDIO            0x0004L /* data pertaining to audio */
01450 
01451 /****************************************************************************
01452  * Data Argument Types                                                      *
01453  ****************************************************************************/
01454 
01455 /*  SDH - 03/23/95 - WATCH                                                  */
01456 /*  The thunker requires knowledge about size of data being passed in the   */
01457 /*  lpData parameter to DS_Entry (which is not readily available due to     */
01458 /*  type LPVOID.  Thus, we key off the DAT_ argument to determine the size. */
01459 /*  This has a couple implications:                                         */
01460 /*  1) Any additional DAT_ features require modifications to the thunk code */
01461 /*     for thunker support.                                                 */
01462 /*  2) Any applications which use the custom capabailites are not supported */
01463 /*     under thunking since we have no way of knowing what size data (if    */
01464 /*     any) is being passed.                                                */
01465 
01466 #define DAT_NULL            0x0000 /* No data or structure. */
01467 #define DAT_CUSTOMBASE      0x8000 /* Base of custom DATs.  */
01468 
01469 /* Data Argument Types for the DG_CONTROL Data Group. */
01470 #define DAT_CAPABILITY      0x0001 /* TW_CAPABILITY                        */
01471 #define DAT_EVENT           0x0002 /* TW_EVENT                             */
01472 #define DAT_IDENTITY        0x0003 /* TW_IDENTITY                          */
01473 #define DAT_PARENT          0x0004 /* TW_HANDLE, application win handle in Windows */
01474 #define DAT_PENDINGXFERS    0x0005 /* TW_PENDINGXFERS                      */
01475 #define DAT_SETUPMEMXFER    0x0006 /* TW_SETUPMEMXFER                      */
01476 #define DAT_SETUPFILEXFER   0x0007 /* TW_SETUPFILEXFER                     */
01477 #define DAT_STATUS          0x0008 /* TW_STATUS                            */
01478 #define DAT_USERINTERFACE   0x0009 /* TW_USERINTERFACE                     */
01479 #define DAT_XFERGROUP       0x000a /* TW_UINT32                            */
01480 /*  SDH - 03/21/95 - TWUNK                                         */
01481 /*  Additional message required for thunker to request the special */
01482 /*  identity information.                                          */
01483 #define DAT_TWUNKIDENTITY   0x000b /* TW_TWUNKIDENTITY                     */
01484 #define DAT_CUSTOMDSDATA    0x000c /* TW_CUSTOMDSDATA.                     */
01485 /* Added 1.8 */
01486 #define DAT_DEVICEEVENT     0x000d /* TW_DEVICEEVENT                       */
01487 #define DAT_FILESYSTEM      0x000e /* TW_FILESYSTEM                        */
01488 #define DAT_PASSTHRU        0x000f /* TW_PASSTHRU                          */
01489 
01490 /* Data Argument Types for the DG_IMAGE Data Group. */
01491 #define DAT_IMAGEINFO       0x0101 /* TW_IMAGEINFO                         */
01492 #define DAT_IMAGELAYOUT     0x0102 /* TW_IMAGELAYOUT                       */
01493 #define DAT_IMAGEMEMXFER    0x0103 /* TW_IMAGEMEMXFER                      */
01494 #define DAT_IMAGENATIVEXFER 0x0104 /* TW_UINT32 loword is hDIB, PICHandle  */
01495 #define DAT_IMAGEFILEXFER   0x0105 /* Null data                            */
01496 #define DAT_CIECOLOR        0x0106 /* TW_CIECOLOR                          */
01497 #define DAT_GRAYRESPONSE    0x0107 /* TW_GRAYRESPONSE                      */
01498 #define DAT_RGBRESPONSE     0x0108 /* TW_RGBRESPONSE                       */
01499 #define DAT_JPEGCOMPRESSION 0x0109 /* TW_JPEGCOMPRESSION                   */
01500 #define DAT_PALETTE8        0x010a /* TW_PALETTE8                          */
01501 #define DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO    0x010b /* TW_EXTIMAGEINFO -- for 1.7 Spec.     */
01502 
01503 /* Added 1.8 */
01504 /* Data Argument Types for the DG_AUDIO Data Group. */
01505 #define DAT_AUDIOFILEXFER   0x0201 /* Null data                            */
01506 #define DAT_AUDIOINFO       0x0202 /* TW_AUDIOINFO                         */
01507 #define DAT_AUDIONATIVEXFER 0x0203 /* TW_UINT32 handle to WAV, (AIFF Mac)  */
01508 
01509 /* Added 1.9 */
01510 #define DAT_ SETUPFILEXFER2 0x0301 /* New file xfer operation              */
01511 
01512 #define DAT_CALLBACK        0x0010
01513 
01514 /****************************************************************************
01515  * Messages                                                                 *
01516  ****************************************************************************/
01517 
01518 /* All message constants are unique.
01519  * Messages are grouped according to which DATs they are used with.*/
01520 
01521 #define MSG_NULL         0x0000 /* Used in TW_EVENT structure               */
01522 #define MSG_CUSTOMBASE   0x8000 /* Base of custom messages                  */
01523 
01524 /* Generic messages may be used with any of several DATs.                   */
01525 #define MSG_GET          0x0001 /* Get one or more values                   */
01526 #define MSG_GETCURRENT   0x0002 /* Get current value                        */
01527 #define MSG_GETDEFAULT   0x0003 /* Get default (e.g. power up) value        */
01528 #define MSG_GETFIRST     0x0004 /* Get first of a series of items, e.g. DSs */
01529 #define MSG_GETNEXT      0x0005 /* Iterate through a series of items.       */
01530 #define MSG_SET          0x0006 /* Set one or more values                   */
01531 #define MSG_RESET        0x0007 /* Set current value to default value       */
01532 #define MSG_QUERYSUPPORT 0x0008 /* Get supported operations on the cap.     */
01533 
01534 /* Messages used with DAT_NULL                                              */
01535 #define MSG_XFERREADY    0x0101 /* The data source has data ready           */
01536 #define MSG_CLOSEDSREQ   0x0102 /* Request for Application. to close DS             */
01537 #define MSG_CLOSEDSOK    0x0103 /* Tell the Application. to save the state.         */
01538 /* Added 1.8 */
01539 #define MSG_DEVICEEVENT  0X0104 /* Some event has taken place               */
01540 
01541 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_STATUS structure                   */
01542 #define MSG_CHECKSTATUS  0x0201 /* Get status information                   */
01543 
01544 /* Messages used with a pointer to DAT_PARENT data                          */
01545 #define MSG_OPENDSM      0x0301 /* Open the DSM                             */
01546 #define MSG_CLOSEDSM     0x0302 /* Close the DSM                            */
01547 
01548 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_IDENTITY structure                 */
01549 #define MSG_OPENDS       0x0401 /* Open a data source                       */
01550 #define MSG_CLOSEDS      0x0402 /* Close a data source                      */
01551 #define MSG_USERSELECT   0x0403 /* Put up a dialog of all DS                */
01552 
01553 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_USERINTERFACE structure            */
01554 #define MSG_DISABLEDS    0x0501 /* Disable data transfer in the DS          */
01555 #define MSG_ENABLEDS     0x0502 /* Enable data transfer in the DS           */
01556 #define MSG_ENABLEDSUIONLY  0x0503  /* Enable for saving DS state only.     */
01557 
01558 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_EVENT structure                    */
01559 #define MSG_PROCESSEVENT 0x0601
01560 
01561 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_PENDINGXFERS structure             */
01562 #define MSG_ENDXFER      0x0701
01563 #define MSG_STOPFEEDER   0x0702
01564 
01565 /* Added 1.8 */
01566 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_FILESYSTEM structure               */
01567 #define MSG_CHANGEDIRECTORY   0x0801
01568 #define MSG_CREATEDIRECTORY   0x0802
01569 #define MSG_DELETE            0x0803
01570 #define MSG_FORMATMEDIA       0x0804 
01571 #define MSG_GETCLOSE          0x0805
01572 #define MSG_GETFIRSTFILE      0x0806
01573 #define MSG_GETINFO           0x0807
01574 #define MSG_GETNEXTFILE       0x0808
01575 #define MSG_RENAME            0x0809
01576 #define MSG_COPY              0x080A
01577 #define MSG_AUTOMATICCAPTUREDIRECTORY 0x080B
01578 
01579 
01580 /* Messages used with a pointer to a DAT_PASSTHRU structure                 */
01581 #define MSG_PASSTHRU          0x0901
01582 
01583 /* used with DAT_CALLBACK */
01584 #define MSG_REGISTER_CALLBACK 0x0902

01812 /***************************************************************************
01813  *            Return Codes and Condition Codes section                     *
01814  ***************************************************************************/
01815 
01816 /* Return Codes: DSM_Entry and DS_Entry may return any one of these values. */
01817 #define TWRC_CUSTOMBASE     0x8000
01818 
01819 #define TWRC_SUCCESS          0
01820 #define TWRC_FAILURE          1 /* Application may get TW_STATUS for info on failure */
01821 #define TWRC_CHECKSTATUS      2 /* "tried hard"; get status                  */
01822 #define TWRC_CANCEL           3
01823 #define TWRC_DSEVENT          4
01824 #define TWRC_NOTDSEVENT       5
01825 #define TWRC_XFERDONE         6
01826 #define TWRC_ENDOFLIST        7 /* After MSG_GETNEXT if nothing left         */
01827 #define TWRC_INFONOTSUPPORTED 8
01828 #define TWRC_DATANOTAVAILABLE 9
01829 
01830 /* Condition Codes: Application gets these by doing DG_CONTROL DAT_STATUS MSG_GET.  */
01831 #define TWCC_CUSTOMBASE         0x8000
01832 
01833 #define TWCC_SUCCESS            0 /* It worked!                                */
01834 #define TWCC_BUMMER             1 /* Failure due to unknown causes             */
01835 #define TWCC_LOWMEMORY          2 /* Not enough memory to perform operation    */
01836 #define TWCC_NODS               3 /* No Data Source                            */
01837 #define TWCC_MAXCONNECTIONS     4 /* DS is connected to max possible applications      */
01838 #define TWCC_OPERATIONERROR     5 /* DS or DSM reported error, application shouldn't   */
01839 #define TWCC_BADCAP             6 /* Unknown capability                        */
01840 #define TWCC_BADPROTOCOL        9 /* Unrecognized MSG DG DAT combination       */
01841 #define TWCC_BADVALUE           10 /* Data parameter out of range              */
01842 #define TWCC_SEQERROR           11 /* DG DAT MSG out of expected sequence      */
01843 #define TWCC_BADDEST            12 /* Unknown destination Application/Source in DSM_Entry */
01844 #define TWCC_CAPUNSUPPORTED     13 /* Capability not supported by source            */
01845 #define TWCC_CAPBADOPERATION    14 /* Operation not supported by capability         */
01846 #define TWCC_CAPSEQERROR        15 /* Capability has dependancy on other capability */
01847 /* Added 1.8 */
01848 #define TWCC_DENIED             16 /* File System operation is denied (file is protected) */
01849 #define TWCC_FILEEXISTS         17 /* Operation failed because file already exists. */
01850 #define TWCC_FILENOTFOUND       18 /* File not found */
01851 #define TWCC_NOTEMPTY           19 /* Operation failed because directory is not empty */
01852 #define TWCC_PAPERJAM           20  /* The feeder is jammed */
01853 #define TWCC_PAPERDOUBLEFEED    21  /* The feeder detected multiple pages */
01854 #define TWCC_FILEWRITEERROR     22  /* Error writing the file (meant for things like disk full conditions) */
01855 #define TWCC_CHECKDEVICEONLINE  23  /* The device went offline prior to or during this operation */
01856 
01857 
01858 /* bit patterns: for query the operation that are supported by the data source on a capability */
01859 /* Application gets these through DG_CONTROL/DAT_CAPABILITY/MSG_QUERYSUPPORT */
01860 /* Added 1.6 */
01861 #define TWQC_GET           0x0001 
01862 #define TWQC_SET           0x0002
01863 #define TWQC_GETDEFAULT    0x0004
01864 #define TWQC_GETCURRENT    0x0008
01865 #define TWQC_RESET         0x0010

01867 
01868 /****************************************************************************
01869  * Entry Points                                                             *
01870  ****************************************************************************/
01871 
01872 /**********************************************************************
01873  * Function: DSM_Entry, the only entry point into the Data Source Manager.
01874  *
01875  * Parameters:
01876  *  pOrigin Identifies the source module of the message. This could
01877  *          identify an Application, a Source, or the Source Manager.
01878  *
01879  *  pDest   Identifies the destination module for the message.
01880  *          This could identify an application or a data source.
01881  *          If this is NULL, the message goes to the Source Manager.
01882  *
01883  *  DG      The Data Group. 
01884  *          Example: DG_IMAGE.
01885  *
01886  *  DAT     The Data Attribute Type.
01887  *          Example: DAT_IMAGEMEMXFER.
01888  *    
01889  *  MSG     The message.  Messages are interpreted by the destination module
01890  *          with respect to the Data Group and the Data Attribute Type.  
01891  *          Example: MSG_GET.
01892  *
01893  *  pData   A pointer to the data structure or variable identified 
01894  *          by the Data Attribute Type.
01895  *          Example: (TW_MEMREF)&ImageMemXfer
01896  *                   where ImageMemXfer is a TW_IMAGEMEMXFER structure.
01897  *                    
01898  * Returns:
01899  *  ReturnCode
01900  *         Example: TWRC_SUCCESS.
01901  *
01902  ********************************************************************/
01903 
01904 /* Don't mangle the name "DSM_Entry" if we're compiling in C++! */
01905 #ifdef  __cplusplus
01906 extern "C" {
01907 #endif  /* __cplusplus */
01908 
01909 #ifdef  _MSWIN_
01910 TW_UINT16 FAR PASCAL DSM_Entry( pTW_IDENTITY pOrigin,
01911                                 pTW_IDENTITY pDest,
01912                                 TW_UINT32    DG,
01913                                 TW_UINT16    DAT,
01914                                 TW_UINT16    MSG,
01915                                 TW_MEMREF    pData);
01916 
01917 typedef TW_UINT16 (FAR PASCAL *DSMENTRYPROC)(pTW_IDENTITY, pTW_IDENTITY,
01918                                              TW_UINT32,    TW_UINT16,
01919                                              TW_UINT16,    TW_MEMREF);
01920 #else   /* _MSWIN_ */
01921 
01922 FAR PASCAL TW_UINT16 DSM_Entry( pTW_IDENTITY pOrigin,
01923                                 pTW_IDENTITY pDest,
01924                                 TW_UINT32    DG,
01925                                 TW_UINT16    DAT,
01926                                 TW_UINT16    MSG,
01927                                 TW_MEMREF    pData);
01928 
01929 typedef TW_UINT16 (*DSMENTRYPROC)(pTW_IDENTITY, pTW_IDENTITY,
01930                                   TW_UINT32,    TW_UINT16,
01931                                   TW_UINT16,    TW_MEMREF);
01932 #endif  /* _MSWIN_ */
01933 
01934 #ifdef  __cplusplus
01935 }
01936 #endif  /* cplusplus */
01937 
01938 
01939 /**********************************************************************
01940  * Function: DS_Entry, the entry point provided by a Data Source.
01941  *
01942  * Parameters:
01943  *  pOrigin Identifies the source module of the message. This could
01944  *          identify an application or the Data Source Manager.
01945  *
01946  *  DG      The Data Group. 
01947  *          Example: DG_IMAGE.
01948  *           
01949  *  DAT     The Data Attribute Type.
01950  *          Example: DAT_IMAGEMEMXFER.
01951  *    
01952  *  MSG     The message.  Messages are interpreted by the data source
01953  *          with respect to the Data Group and the Data Attribute Type.
01954  *          Example: MSG_GET.
01955  *
01956  *  pData   A pointer to the data structure or variable identified 
01957  *          by the Data Attribute Type.
01958  *          Example: (TW_MEMREF)&ImageMemXfer
01959  *                   where ImageMemXfer is a TW_IMAGEMEMXFER structure.
01960  *                    
01961  * Returns:
01962  *  ReturnCode
01963  *          Example: TWRC_SUCCESS.
01964  *
01965  * Note:
01966  *  The DSPROC type is only used by an application when it calls
01967  *  a Data Source directly, bypassing the Data Source Manager.
01968  *
01969  ********************************************************************/
01970 /* Don't mangle the name "DS_Entry" if we're compiling in C++! */
01971 #ifdef  __cplusplus
01972 extern "C" {
01973 #endif  /* __cplusplus */
01974 
01975 #ifdef  _MSWIN_
01976   #ifdef _WIN32
01977      __declspec(dllexport) TW_UINT16 FAR PASCAL DS_Entry (pTW_IDENTITY pOrigin,
01978                                                           TW_UINT32    DG, 
01979                                                           TW_UINT16    DAT, 
01980                                                           TW_UINT16    MSG, 
01981                                                           TW_MEMREF    pData);
01982   #else   /* _WIN32 */
01983      TW_UINT16 FAR PASCAL DS_Entry (pTW_IDENTITY pOrigin,
01984                                     TW_UINT32    DG, 
01985                                     TW_UINT16    DAT, 
01986                                     TW_UINT16    MSG, 
01987                                     TW_MEMREF    pData);
01988   #endif  /* _WIN32 */
01989   
01990   typedef TW_UINT16 (FAR PASCAL *DSENTRYPROC) (pTW_IDENTITY pOrigin,
01991                                                TW_UINT32    DG, 
01992                                                TW_UINT16    DAT, 
01993                                                TW_UINT16    MSG, 
01994                                                TW_MEMREF    pData);
01995 #else   /* _MSWIN_ */
01996 FAR PASCAL TW_UINT16 DS_Entry( pTW_IDENTITY pOrigin, 
01997                                TW_UINT32    DG, 
01998                                TW_UINT16    DAT, 
01999                                TW_UINT16    MSG, 
02000                                TW_MEMREF    pData);
02001 
02002 typedef TW_UINT16 (*DSENTRYPROC)(pTW_IDENTITY,
02003                                   TW_UINT32,    TW_UINT16,
02004                                   TW_UINT16,    TW_MEMREF);
02005 #endif  /* _MSWIN_ */
02006 
02007 #ifdef  __cplusplus
02008 }
02009 #endif  /* cplusplus */
02010 
02011 /*  SDH - 02/08/95 - TWUNK */
02012 /*  Force 32-bit twain to use same packing of twain structures as existing */
02013 /*  16-bit twain.  This allows 16/32-bit thunking. */
02014 #ifdef  _MSWIN_
02015     #ifdef __BORLANDC__ //(Mentor June 13, 1996) if we're using a Borland compiler
02016         #pragma option -a.  //(Mentor October 30, 1996) switch back to original alignment
02017     #else   //(Mentor June 13, 1996) if NOT using a Borland compiler
